meanings.definition: A small, edible fish of the herring family.
meanings.sent1: I saw a school of pilchards swimming in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught a large haul of pilchards for the market.
meanings.sent3: The pilchards at the seafood restaurant were so fresh, they practically jumped onto my plate!
meanings.sent4: The shimmering silver pilchards in the water looked like a moving silver carpet.
meanings.sent5: The children at the beach were amazed by the glimmering pilchards darting in the waves.

meanings.sent1: I opened a can of pilchards for a quick snack.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store shelves were stocked with cans of pilchards.
meanings.sent3: When I opened the can of pilchards, they seemed to be doing a little fishy dance inside.
meanings.sent4: The can of pilchards on the shelf gleamed like a tiny silver treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the pilchards in the can made my mouth water.
